duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform all technical and mechanical aspects of Magnetic Resonance Imaging, including positioning and technical factors, taking into account patient's age, condition, and ability to communicate.
Assess and recognize normal/abnormal anatomy/pathology, tailoring scope of exam as indicated.
Review exams with Radiologist as necessary, contributing technical and professional knowledge.
Display knowledge of principles of Magnetic Resonance Imaging.
Respond appropriately to medical emergencies and function effectively in stressful situations.
Communicate effectively with patients, patient's families, staff, physicians, and medical office personnel.
Perform Point of Care Testing and responsible for QA and maintenance on Point of Care equipment.
Demonstrate knowledge of appropriate clinical history for each MRI exam and cross-train to CT.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of accredited MRI program and/or current R.T. (MRI) (ARRT) registration.
R.T. (MR) (ARRT) MRI registration required within one year of hire.
